{{Infobox album | Name = Ys | Type = studio | Artist = [[Joanna Newsom]] | Cover = Ys cover.jpg | Released = November 6, 2006 ([[UK]])
November 14, 2006 ([[U.S.]]) | Recorded = December 2005, [[Los Angeles|L.A.]]
MayâJune 2006, L.A. (orchestra) | Genre = [[Independent music|Indie]], [[Folk music|folk]] | Length = 55:38 | Label = [[Drag City (record label)|Drag City]] | Producer = [[Joanna Newsom]], [[Van Dyke Parks]] | Last album = ''[[The Milk-Eyed Mender]]''
(2004) | This album = '''''Ys'''''
(2006) | Next album = ''[[Have One on Me]]''
(2010) }} '''''Ys''''' (pronounced {{IPAc-en|Ë|iË|s}} {{respell|EESS|'}}) is the second [[album]] by [[Joanna Newsom]]. It was released by [[Drag City (record label)|Drag City]] on November 14, [[2006 in music|2006]] to widespread critical acclaim. The album was named after the city of [[Ys]], which according to myth was built on the coast of [[Brittany]] and later swallowed by the ocean. In recent years, the album has been featured on several music publications' lists of the greatest albums of the 2000s as well as all-time. ==Production== The album features full [[orchestra]] arrangements by [[Van Dyke Parks]] on four of the five tracks. Parks also contributes [[accordion]]. Newsom's harp and vocals were recorded by [[Steve Albini]] and the orchestra was recorded by Tim Boyle. Newsom and Parks produced the album and it was mixed by [[Jim O'Rourke (musician)|Jim O'Rourke]]. The recording process was completely [[analog recording|analog]], on two 24-track tape recorders. The music was mixed to tape and mastered at [[Abbey Road Studios]].{{cite web |url= http://www.brooklynvegan.com/archives/2006/08/joanna_newsoms.html |title= Joanna Newsom's 2nd album details |author= brooklynvegan |date=2006-08-16 |accessdate=2008-01-12}} [[Bass guitar]] is contributed by [[Leland Sklar|Lee Sklar]], and [[electric guitar]] by [[jazz]] guitarist [[Grant Geissman]]. Don Heffington played percussion and Matt Cartsonis played mandolin and banjo. [[Smog (band)|Bill Callahan]] provides backing vocals on the song "Only Skin", while on "Emily" these are sung by Joanna's sister Emily Newsom, after whom the song is named. The album, particularly the length of the songs and orchestral arrangements, was inspired by the 1971 [[Roy Harper]] album ''[[Stormcock (album)|Stormcock]]''.{{cite web |url= http://www.harpmagazine.com/articles/detail.cfm?article_id=4947 |title= Joanna Newsom:Strings Attached |author= Mark Guarino |date=December, 2006 |accessdate=2008-01-12}} In September 2007, Harper supported Joanna Newsom at her [[Royal Albert Hall]] performance, playing ''Stormcock'' in its entirety. Newsom was also impressed by [[Van Dyke Parks|Van Dyke Parks']] 1968 album ''[[Song Cycle (album)|Song Cycle]]'', and asked him to collaborate on ''Ys'' after listening to that record.{{cite web|url=http://www.arthurmag.com/2006/12/23/nearer-the-heart-of-things-erik-davis-on-joanna-newsom-from-arthur-no-25winter-02006/ |title=Arthur Magazine Feature on Joanna Newsom |publisher=Arthurmag.com |date=2011-09-08 |accessdate=2011-11-24}} On her fall 2007 tour, Newsom performed the album in its entirety, backed by a 29-piece orchestra.{{cite web |url= http://www.pitchforkmedia.com/page/news/46550-photos-joanna-newsom-with-orchestra-milwaukee-wi-102107 |title= Joanna Newsom with Orchestra |author= Matthew Solarski |date=2007-10-22 |accessdate=2008-01-12}} ==Reception== {{Album ratings | title = | subtitle = | state = | MC = (85%){{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/artists/newsomjoanna/ys|title=Ys reviews at location=London}} | rev6 = [[Pitchfork Media]] | rev6Score = (9.4/10){{cite web|url=http://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/record_review/39644/Joanna_Newsom_Ys/ |title=Album Reviews: Joanna Newsom: Ys |publisher=Pitchfork |date=2006-11-13 |accessdate=2010-03-05}} | rev7 = ''[[PopMatters]]'' | rev7Score = (10/10){{cite web|url=http://www.popmatters.com/pm/music/reviews/7242/joanna-newsom-ys |title=Joanna Newsom: Ys < Reviews |publisher=PopMatters |date= 2006-11-12 |accessdate=2010-03-05}} | rev8 = [[Robert Christgau]] | rev8Score = (C+){{cite web|url=http://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?name=Joanna+Newsom |title= Robert Christgau: CG: Joanna Newsom |year=2006 |accessdate=2010-03-05}} | rev9 = ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' | rev9Score = {{Rating|2|5}} | rev10 = ''[[Uncut (magazine)|Uncut]]'' | rev10Score = {{Rating|5|5}}{{cite web|url=http://www.uncut.co.uk/music/joanna_newsom/reviews/8992 |title=Joanna Newsom â Ys â Review- Uncut.co.uk |publisher=Uncut.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2010-03-05}} }} The album leaked onto the Internet over two months in advance of its release when it was left unprotected on servers belonging to music criticism website [[Pitchfork Media]].{{cite web |url= http://billboard.blogs.com/jadedinsider/2006/08/leaky_pipes.html |title= Leaky Pipes |author= jadedinsider |date=August 31, 2006 |accessdate=2008-01-12}} ''Ys'' is Newsom's first album to chart on the U.S. music charts and it has sold more than 250,000 copies.{{cite news| url=http://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/07/magazine/07Newsom-t.html?ref=magazine&pagewanted=all | work=The New York Times | title=Joanna Newsom, the Changeling | first=Jody | last=Rosen | date=2010-03-07}}{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/retrieve_chart_history.do?model.chartFormatGroupName=Albums&model.vnuArtistId=514942&model.vnuAlbumId=799640 |title= Joanna Newsom â Artist Chart History |accessdate=2008-01-12}} The album entered the [[Irish Album Chart]] at #50, and was also nominated for a 2007 [[Shortlist Music Prize]].{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/search/google/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003578174 |title= Shortlist Music Prize Finalists Announced |author= Todd Martens |date=2007-04-30 |accessdate=2008-01-12}} The track "Emily" was ranked #9 in [[Pitchfork Media]]'s Top 100 Tracks 2006. Since its release on November 14, 2006, ''Ys'' has received widespread critical acclaim, including a #1 ranking in [[Tiny Mix Tapes]]' Top 25 Albums of 2006,{{cite web |url= http://www.tinymixtapes.com/2006-Tiny-Mix-Tapes-Favorite |title= 2006: Tiny Mix Tapes Favorite Albums of 2006 |author= Tiny Mix Tapes Staff |accessdate=2008-01-12}} and CHARTbeat's Top 100 Albums of 2006 {{cite web |url= http://www.schitterdisko.nl/top2006/top2006.html |title= Top 100 Albums of 2006 |date=2006-12-31 |accessdate=2008-01-12}} a #3 ranking on [[Pitchfork Media]]'s Top 50 Albums of 2006,{{cite web |url=http://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/feature/40007-staff-list-top-50-albums-of-2006 |title=Top 50 Albums of 2006 |date=2006-12-19 |author=Pitchfork staff |work=[[Pitchfork Media]] }} and a #7 ranking [[Time (magazine)|''Time'' magazine]]'s 10 Best Albums of 2006. It currently has a score of 85 out of 100, the 15th highest scoring album of 2006 on [[Metacritic]]. By the end of 2006 ''Ys'' appeared in more than 50 year-end lists, placing inside the top 10 in 35 of them.{{cite web|url=http://acclaimedmusic.net/Current/A3091.htm |title=Ys |publisher=Acclaimed Music |date= |accessdate=2011-11-24}} Despite a negative review by the US ''[[Rolling Stone]]'',{{cite web | url= http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/joannanewsom/albums/album/12006524/review/12020211/ys | title= Ys}} the German version of the magazine named the album the second greatest of the year.{{cite web|author=Thomas Schulze |url=http://rz-home.de/~tommi.s/rs02.htm#2006k |title=Rolling Stone - Deutsche Ausgabe - Popular Music Best-Of-Lists List - 2002-2006 - hartbeat! die besten, CDs, album, alben, records |publisher=Rz-home.de |date= |accessdate=2011-11-24}} According to Acclaimedmusic.net ''Ys'' is the third best album of 2006,{{cite web|url=http://acclaimedmusic.net/Current/2006a.htm |title=The Top Albums from 2006 |publisher=Acclaimed Music |date= |accessdate=2011-11-24}} and so far is the 27th greatest record released this decade{{cite web|url=http://acclaimedmusic.net/Current/Joanna%20Newsom.htm |title=Joanna Newsom |publisher=Acclaimed Music |date= |accessdate=2011-11-24}} and the 271st greatest of all-time. The album was also included in the book ''[[1001 Albums You Must Hear Before You Die]]''. In 2009, the album started to appear in many "best of the decade" lists. [[Pitchfork Media]] named ''Ys'' the 83rd greatest album of the 2000s. Calling Newsom "unlike anyone else" aside calling the album "the most artistically ambitious indie rock enterprise of the decade"{{cite web|url=http://pitchfork.com/features/staff-lists/7708-the-top-200-albums-of-the-2000s-100-51/2/ |title=Staff Lists: The Top 200 Albums of the 2000s: 100-51 | Features |publisher=Pitchfork |date=2009-09-30 |accessdate=2011-11-24}} ''Ys'' is one of two Joanna Newsom albums placed inside the top 100, the other being ''[[The Milk-Eyed Mender]]'' .{{cite web|url=http://pitchfork.com/features/staff-lists/7709-the-top-200-albums-of-the-2000s-50-21/ |title=Staff Lists: The Top 200 Albums of the 2000s: 50-21 | Features |publisher=Pitchfork |date=2009-10-01 |accessdate=2011-11-24}} UK magazine ''[[Uncut (magazine)|Uncut]]'' placed the album inside their "150 greatest album of the decade" list, at number 21. [[Gigwise]] named ''Ys'' the 32nd greatest album of the 2000s commenting that "the record rightly received blanket acclaim upon its initial release and is already sounding better with age. Whether she'll ever top this new-folk masterpiece remains to be seen."{{cite web|url=http://www.gigwise.com/photos/52489/19/The-50-Greatest-Albums-of-the-2000s |title=The 50 Greatest Albums of the 2000s! |publisher=Gigwise |date=2009-09-17 |accessdate=2011-11-24}} ''[[The Times]]'' placed the album at number 26 in their top 100 albums of the decade list,{{cite news| url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/article6922991.ece?token=null&offset=132&page=12 | work=The Times | location=London | title=The 100 best pop albums of the Noughties | date=2009-11-21}} while ''[[The Guardian]]'' named it one of the '1000 Albums To Hear Before You Die'.{{cite news| url=http://music.guardian.co.uk/1000albums | work=The Guardian | location=London | title=Music 1000 albums front}} British magazine ''Clash'' placed ''Ys'' at number 13 in their '50 Greatest Albums Of Our Lifetime' list.{{cite web|url=http://pub37.bravenet.com/forum/static/show.php?usernum=3172289350&frmid=10&msgid=970103&cmd=show |title=Acclaimed Music Forum |publisher=Pub37.bravenet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-24}} German magazine ''Musikexpress'' named ''Ys'' the 92nd greatest album of the last four decades (1969â2009).{{cite web|url=http://pub37.bravenet.com/forum/static/show.php?usernum=3172289350&frmid=10&msgid=1006224&cmd=show |title=Acclaimed Music Forum |publisher=Pub37.bravenet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-24}} Two Spanish magazines, ''Playground'' and ''Rock de Lux'', have respectively named ''Ys'' their 83rd and 15th greatest album of the 2000s.{{cite web|url=http://pub37.bravenet.com/forum/static/show.php?usernum=3172289350&frmid=10&msgid=1010589&cmd=show |title=Acclaimed Music Forum |publisher=Pub37.bravenet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-24}}{{cite web|url=http://pub37.bravenet.com/forum/static/show.php?usernum=3172289350&frmid=10&msgid=1011603&cmd=show |title=Acclaimed Music Forum |publisher=Pub37.bravenet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-24}} [[About.com|About]] placed ''Ys'' at number one inside their greatest album of the decade list.{{cite web|url=http://altmusic.about.com/od/top10lists/tp/top-100-albums-of-the-2000s.09.htm |title=Albums of the 2000s - Best Alternative Music of the Decade |publisher=Altmusic.about.com |date=2011-06-16 |accessdate=2011-11-24}} In 2010, [[Tiny Mix Tapes]] named the album the 18th greatest of the 2000s and Cokemachineglow.com the 81st.{{cite web|url=http://www.tinymixtapes.com/features/favorite-100-albums-2000-2009-20-01 |title=Favorite 100 Albums of 2000-2009: 20-01 | Staff Feature |publisher=Tiny Mix Tapes |date=2009-01-20 |accessdate=2011-11-24}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cokemachineglow.com/feature/5204/top100albums-2000s?pg=2 |title=List / Top 100 Albums of the 2000s | Features |publisher=Cokemachineglow.com |date=2010-03-16 |accessdate=2011-11-24}} [[Rhapsody]] named it the 46th best album of the 00s.{{cite web|url=http://blog.rhapsody.com/2009/12/100-best-pop-albums-of-the-decade-50-41.html |title=100 Best Albums of the Decade, 41-50 - Rhapsody: The Mix |publisher=Blog.rhapsody.com |date=2009-12-04 |accessdate=2011-11-24}} ==Track listing== All songs written by Joanna Newsom. # "Emily" â 12:07 #
